page.title: 05HEALTH 2
page.content:
{DISTRICT NURSE:}The district nurse takes care of young babies. Some parents do not need the district nurse after the midwife has been on the eighth day.
{AUXILLARIES:}These are not trained nurses, but help people in need. They quite often help out with all the odd jobs that need doing in the home.
{TREATMENT ROOM NURSES:}They work in a small room in the health centre. In the room there are{3}beds and{4}nurses work in the room. The nurses are allowed to do no more than{2 stitches, and the room is often used for this purpose.
{SCHOOL NURSE:}They are stationed at the health centre and do{eye tests, {hearing tests}and check for{headlice.
